intro: Seringia nephrosperma, commonly known as the kidneypod seringia, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to the arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, particularly Namibia and South Africa. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to survive in dry conditions. Seringia nephrosperma plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
